assignment2

Class Menus

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment2.Menus

  • public class Menus
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to create menu bar for the web browser

    This class contains separate methods to create different menu and menu items

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rifat Shams
    See Also:
    File, MalformedURLException, URL, ArrayList, Platform, ActionEvent, EventHandler, Alert, Alert.AlertType, Button, ContextMenu, CustomMenuItem, Label, Menu, MenuBar, MenuItem, ScrollPane, ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy, KeyCombination, MouseButton, BorderPane, HBox, VBox, Text, WebEngine, WebHistory, WebView

      • getMenuBar

        public static javafx.scene.control.MenuBar getMenuBar(javafx.scene.web.WebView view,
                                                      javafx.scene.layout.VBox topPane,
                                                      javafx.scene.layout.HBox addressBarPane,
                                                      javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane root,
                                                      javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane codePane)
        Method that creates an return the menu bar for the application
        Parameters:
        view - The webview object that shows the web pages to the user
        topPane - The top pane that contains the menubar and addressbar
        addressBarPane - The pane that contains the addressbar text field and go button
        root - The main container for the application
        codePane - The scrollpane that contains the text area for the code area
        Returns:
        The menu bar of the application

      • getMenuItemForBookMark

        private static javafx.scene.control.MenuItem getMenuItemForBookMark(java.lang.String url)
        Utility method to create Menu item for a bookmark address

        The method creates a CustomMenuItem for the bookmark. It also sets up handler to handle right and left click on the menu item

        Parameters:
        url - The bookmark address
        Returns:
        The menu item for the bookmark

      • getMnuItmAbout

        Method to create the About menu item
        Returns:
        The About menu item

      • getMnuItm

        private static javafx.scene.control.MenuItem getMnuItm(java.lang.String name,
                                                       java.lang.String accelerator,
                                                       javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> handler)
        Utility method to create menu items

        The method creats a menu item with the specified name and sets the accelerator key and action handler for the menu item

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the menu item
        accelerator - The accelerator key for the menu item
        handler - The handler for the menu item
        Returns:
        The created menu item

      • getHistoryPane

        private static javafx.scene.layout.VBox getHistoryPane()
        Method to create a pane to show the web page history in the browser

        The method creates a VBox for the history pane. It contains a scrollpane that shows the history and two buttons, back and forward which lets user to navigate through the history list

        Returns:
        The history pane

      • setButtonBackState

        private static void setButtonBackState(int currentIndex,
                                       javafx.scene.control.Button buttonBack)
        Method to set the state of the Back button based on current position in the history list

        The Back button will be disabled if the first page of the history is currently showing else it will be enabled

        Parameters:
        currentIndex - The current position in the history list
        buttonBack - The Back button

      • setButtonForwardState

        private static void setButtonForwardState(int currentIndex,
                                          int size,
                                          javafx.scene.control.Button buttonForward)
        Method to set the state of the Forward button based on current position in the history list

        The Forward button will be disabled if the last page of the history is currently showing else it will be enabled

        Parameters:
        currentIndex - The current position in the history list
        size - The size of the history list
        buttonForward - The forward button

      • getDefaultWebPage

        public static java.lang.String getDefaultWebPage()
        Method to return the default web page address

        The method reads the "default.web" file to read the default web page. If the file does not exist it returns www.google.ca

        Returns:
        The default web page address

      • saveBookmarksInFile

        public static void saveBookmarksInFile()
        Method to save the bookmarks in the file

        The method saves the bookmarks in "bookmarks.web" file

      • getBookmarksFromFile

        private static void getBookmarksFromFile()
        Method to load the saved book marks from the file

        The method reads the bookmarks from "bookmarks.web" file
